course.description_en: Complete your alphabet journey by learning the second half of letters. Discover letters N through Z with fun characters, stories, and activities that make learning exciting.
course.description_ar: أكمل رحلة الأبجدية من خلال تعلم النصف الثاني من الحروف. اكتشف الحروف من ن إلى ي مع الشخصيات والقصص والأنشطة الممتعة التي تجعل التعلم مثيرًا.
course.subject: language_arts

lessons.title_en: N is for Nose and Net

content_data.title: Nelly's Nose and Nathan's Net
content_data.content: Meet Nelly! Nelly has a special nose. N makes the sound 'nuh' like when you say 'no.' Nelly's nose can smell nice things. Flowers smell nice. Cookies smell nice. Nelly meets Nathan with his net. Net also starts with N! Nathan catches butterflies with his net. 'Nuh for nose!' says Nelly. 'Nuh for net!' says Nathan. They find more N words together. Nuts start with N. Nap starts with N. Night starts with N. N is a wonderful letter!
learning_objectives: Learn that N makes the 'nuh' sound
Identify words that start with N

vocabulary_words.definition: Part of your face that smells things
Thing with holes that catches butterflies or fish
Good and pleasant, makes you happy
Hard little foods that squirrels like to eat
Short sleep during the day
Dark time when we sleep

materials_needed: Large letter N written on paper
content_data.parent_guidance: Point to child's nose and yours when talking about noses. Let child smell safe, pleasant scents. Show how nets work with toy or kitchen colander. Practice the 'nuh' sound clearly and have child repeat it.
safety_notes: Use only safe, pleasant smells
Keep scented items at safe distance from nose
Ensure toy nets have no sharp edges
Supervise all smelling activities
Use large, safe objects for demonstration
discussion_questions: What does your nose do?
What sound does N make?
What nice things can you smell?

extension_activities.title: N Sound Hunt
extension_activities.description: Look for things around house that start with N sound.

extension_activities.title: Nose Smelling Game
extension_activities.description: Safely smell different pleasant items and describe them.

content_data.title: Owl, Pig, and Queen Bee Adventures
content_data.content: Let's meet three special letter friends! O is for Owl. Owl says 'oh, oh' and flies at night. Owls are very wise birds. P is for Pig. Pig says 'puh, puh' and loves to roll in mud. Pigs are pink and round. Q is for Queen bee. Queen says 'kwuh, kwuh' and wears a crown. Queen bees are very important! Let's move like our animal friends! Flap your arms like Owl and say 'oh!' Roll around like Pig and say 'puh!' March proudly like Queen bee and say 'kwuh!' O, P, Q are special letters!
learning_objectives: Recognize letters O, P, and Q
Practice letter sounds through animal movements

vocabulary_words.definition: Bird with big eyes that flies at night
Pink farm animal that says oink
Very important lady who wears a crown
Very smart and knows many things
Special hat that queens and kings wear
Very special and needed

materials_needed: Large letters O, P, Q written on paper
Pictures of owl, pig, queen bee
content_data.parent_guidance: Practice each letter sound clearly with child. Demonstrate the animal movements safely. Help child understand that Q usually needs U to make the 'kwuh' sound. Keep movements gentle and fun.
safety_notes: Keep all movements gentle and controlled
Ensure safe space for flapping and rolling motions
Hold child's hand during movements if needed
If using crown, ensure it fits safely
Take breaks between different animal actions
discussion_questions: What sound does the owl letter make?
How do pigs like to play?
What makes the queen bee special?

extension_activities.title: Animal Sound Orchestra
extension_activities.description: Make all three letter sounds together like a musical group.

extension_activities.title: Letter Animal Parade
extension_activities.description: March around room being each animal while making their letter sounds.
materials: Pictures of O, P, Q animals

content_data.title: Robot, Sun, and Tiger's Great Day
content_data.content: Today we meet three busy friends! First is Robot who starts with R. R says 'ruh, ruh' like a motor running. Robot moves with stiff arms and legs. Next is Sun who starts with S. S says 'sss' like a snake. Sun shines bright and warm all day. Last is Tiger who starts with T. T says 'tuh, tuh' like tapping. Tiger has orange stripes and likes to prowl. Robot, Sun, and Tiger decide to play together! Robot marches in the sunshine. Sun warms Tiger's stripes. Tiger plays with Robot's shadow. 'Ruh, ruh, Robot!' 'Sss, sss, Sun!' 'Tuh, tuh, Tiger!' They are the best of friends!
learning_objectives: Recognize letters R, S, and T
Follow a story with multiple letter characters

vocabulary_words.definition: Machine that moves and can help people
Bright yellow circle in sky that gives light
Big orange cat with black stripes
Part of machine that makes it move
Lines of different colors
Dark shape you make when sun shines on you

materials_needed: Large letters R, S, T written on paper
Orange and black crayons for stripes
content_data.parent_guidance: Act out the story with child using props. Practice robot movements with stiff arms. Use flashlight to show how shadows work. Let child draw simple stripes. Make each letter sound clearly.
safety_notes: Keep robot movements gentle to prevent falls
Use flashlight safely - avoid shining in eyes
Supervise all shadow play activities
Ensure crayons are non-toxic and age-appropriate
Keep story activities calm and controlled
discussion_questions: How does Robot move?
What does Sun do for us?
What do Tiger's stripes look like?

extension_activities.title: R-S-T Story Acting
extension_activities.description: Act out the story being Robot, Sun, and Tiger with movements.

extension_activities.title: Shadow Play Fun
extension_activities.description: Use flashlight to make hand shadows on wall.

content_data.title: Umbrella, Van, and Wave Say Hello
content_data.content: Let's meet three friends who like to say hello! U is for Umbrella. U says 'uh, uh' when rain comes down. Umbrellas keep us dry! V is for Van. V says 'vuh, vuh' like a motor vrooming. Vans take families on trips. W is for Wave. W says 'wuh, wuh' like water moving. Waves splash at the beach! Now let's move with our friends! Hold umbrella up high and say 'uh!' Drive like a van and say 'vuh!' Wave your arms like water and say 'wuh!' U, V, W are great letter friends!
learning_objectives: Recognize letters U, V, and W
Practice letter sounds through movement activities

vocabulary_words.definition: Thing that keeps rain off you
Big car that carries many people
Water that moves up and down at beach
Not wet, no water on it
Going somewhere fun in a car or van
Sound water makes when it moves

materials_needed: Large letters U, V, W written on paper
content_data.parent_guidance: Let child hold umbrella safely during U part. Use toy van to demonstrate driving motions. Show wave movements with scarf or arms. Practice each letter sound clearly with child.
safety_notes: Ensure umbrella has no sharp points
Supervise umbrella use at all times
Use only large, safe toy vehicles
Keep wave movements gentle to prevent falls
Ensure safe space for all movement activities
discussion_questions: When do we use an umbrella?
Where can vans take us?
How do waves move at the beach?

extension_activities.title: U-V-W Motion Dance
extension_activities.description: Dance using umbrella, van, and wave movements to music.

extension_activities.title: Transportation Game
extension_activities.description: Pretend to travel in different vehicles making V sounds.

content_data.title: X-ray and Xylophone's Treasure Hunt
content_data.content: Today we learn about the special letter X! X is different from other letters. X makes the 'ks' sound like in 'box.' But X can also make the 'z' sound like in 'xylophone!' Let's meet X-ray! X-ray helps doctors see inside our bodies. X-ray says 'ks, ks' like the end of 'box.' Now meet Xylophone! Xylophone makes beautiful music. Xylophone says 'z, z' like buzzing. Let's go on a treasure hunt! X marks the spot where treasure hides. Can you find the X? Point to the X and say 'ks!' Hit the xylophone and say 'z!' X is a very special letter!
learning_objectives: Learn X can make 'ks' and 'z' sounds

vocabulary_words.definition: Special picture that shows inside your body
Musical instrument you hit with sticks
Special things that are hidden and valuable
Exact place where something is
People who help keep you healthy
Sound like bees make

materials_needed: Large letter X written on paper
Toy xylophone or pots and spoons
X stickers or tape to mark spots
content_data.parent_guidance: Explain that X is special because it makes different sounds. Use toy xylophone or pots as substitute. Place X stickers around room for treasure hunt. Keep explanation simple about x-rays helping doctors.
safety_notes: Use only safe, age-appropriate musical toys
Supervise all treasure hunt activities
Ensure X markers are large enough to be safe
Keep xylophone mallets away from face
Use gentle tapping sounds only
discussion_questions: What sound does X make?
How do doctors use x-rays?
What does 'X marks the spot' mean?

extension_activities.title: Treasure Map Game
extension_activities.description: Create simple treasure map with X marking special spots.

extension_activities.title: Xylophone Music Time
extension_activities.description: Make music with xylophone while practicing X sounds.

content_data.title: Yo-yo and Zebra Finish Our Alphabet
content_data.content: We're almost done with our alphabet! Let's meet the last two letters! Y is for Yo-yo. Y says 'yuh, yuh' when it goes up and down. Yo-yos are fun toys that spin! Z is for Zebra. Z says 'zzz' like when you sleep. Zebras have black and white stripes! Let's celebrate with Yo-yo and Zebra! Move your hand up and down like a yo-yo and say 'yuh!' Gallop around like a zebra and say 'zzz!' We learned all the letters from A to Z! A, B, C, D, E, F, G... all the way to X, Y, Z! You are an alphabet champion!

vocabulary_words.definition: Toy that goes up and down on a string
Animal like a horse with black and white stripes
Go around and around in circles
How horses run with big jumping steps
Someone who did something really well
Be happy about something special you did

materials_needed: Large letters Y and Z written on paper
All alphabet letters A-Z for review
content_data.parent_guidance: If using yo-yo, supervise carefully and keep movements gentle. Help child make galloping motions safely. Review all alphabet letters learned. Celebrate this major accomplishment enthusiastically!
safety_notes: Supervise yo-yo use carefully
Keep yo-yo string appropriate length
Ensure safe space for galloping motions
Hold child's hand during running movements if needed
Keep celebration positive and controlled
discussion_questions: How does a yo-yo move?
What do zebra stripes look like?
Can you say the whole alphabet?

extension_activities.title: Alphabet Parade
extension_activities.description: March through all letters A-Z making their sounds.

extension_activities.title: Zebra Stripe Art
extension_activities.description: Create zebra stripes using black and white crayons.

content_data.title: What Letters N-Z Do You Remember?
content_data.content: Let's play a fun game about the letters we just learned! I will show you letters N through Z and ask you questions. You can point, make sounds, or tell me the answers!

vocabulary_words.definition: Fun game with questions about what you learned
Keep things in your mind from before

materials_needed: Large letter cards N through Z
Pictures of words starting with each letter
content_data.parent_guidance: Show each letter clearly and give child time to respond. Accept pointing, sounds, or words as answers. Use pictures to help child remember. Keep quiz fun and encouraging.
safety_notes: Keep quiz session positive and fun
No pressure for perfect answers
Take breaks if child seems tired
Celebrate every attempt
discussion_questions: Point to letter N! What sound does it make?
Which letter does Owl start with?
Show me the letter that Pig begins with!
Find the letter Q! What animal starts with Q?
Which letter makes the 'ruh' sound?
Point to S! What starts with S?
Show me the letter that Tiger begins with!
Which letter does Umbrella start with?
Find V! What starts with V?
Point to W! What makes waves?
Show me the special letter X!
Which letter does Yo-yo start with?
Find Z! What animal has stripes?

extension_activities.title: Letter Sound Symphony
extension_activities.description: Make all the letter sounds N-Z together like music.

extension_activities.title: Quick Letter Find
extension_activities.description: Show letters quickly and see which ones child recognizes fastest.

content_data.title: Celebrating Our Complete Alphabet Journey A-Z
content_data.content: WOW! You learned the WHOLE alphabet! From A to Z, you know them all! Let's celebrate every single letter! A says 'ah' for Apple. B says 'buh' for Ball. C says 'kuh' for Cat. D says 'duh' for Dog. E says 'eh' for Elephant. F says 'fuh' for Fish. G says 'guh' for Goat. H says 'huh' for Hat. I says 'ih' for Ice cream. J says 'juh' for Jump. K says 'kuh' for Kick. L says 'luh' for Laugh. M says 'muh' for March. N says 'nuh' for Nose. O says 'oh' for Owl. P says 'puh' for Pig. Q says 'kwuh' for Queen. R says 'ruh' for Robot. S says 'sss' for Sun. T says 'tuh' for Tiger. U says 'uh' for Umbrella. V says 'vuh' for Van. W says 'wuh' for Wave. X says 'ks' for X-ray. Y says 'yuh' for Yo-yo. Z says 'zzz' for Zebra. You are an ALPHABET SUPERSTAR!
learning_objectives: Practice all letter sounds in sequence

vocabulary_words.definition: All of it, every single part
Be very happy about something amazing you did
Long trip or adventure
All finished, nothing missing
Someone who did something really, really well
Something great that you worked hard to do

materials_needed: Complete set of letter cards A-Z
content_data.parent_guidance: Go through every letter enthusiastically with child. Make all sounds together. Do movements for action letters. Take photos to commemorate this huge achievement. Make child feel incredibly proud of learning all 26 letters!
safety_notes: Keep celebration exciting but controlled
Take breaks during long review if needed
Keep music at safe volume
Ensure all materials are safe
Watch for signs of overstimulation
discussion_questions: Which letter was your favorite to learn?
Can you sing the alphabet song now?
What letter do you want to practice more?

extension_activities.title: Complete Alphabet Book
extension_activities.description: Create special book with all letters A-Z and their pictures.

extension_activities.title: Alphabet Master Certificate
extension_activities.description: Make special certificate showing child mastered entire alphabet.

extension_activities.title: Alphabet Teaching Time
extension_activities.description: Child teaches alphabet to family member, toy, or pet.
